org.svvrl.goal.core.util

Class Matrix<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.util.Matrix<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of elements in matrices

    public class Matrix<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a very simple implementation of generic matrices. The elements of a matrix must come from a semiring.
    Author:
    "Ming-Hsien Tsai"

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Matrix(Semiring<T> sr, int nr, int nc, java.lang.Class<? extends T> cls)
      Constructs this matrix with elements from a semiring, a number of rows of this matrix, a number of columns of this matrix, and a type of matrix elements.
      Matrix(Semiring<T> sr, int nr, int nc, T value)
      Constructs this matrix with elements from a semiring, a number of rows of this matrix, a number of columns of this matrix, and an initial value for all elements.
      Matrix(Semiring<T> sr, int nr, int nc, T[][] vals)
      Constructs this matrix with elements from a semiring, a number of rows, a number of columns, and an initial values of matrix elements.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if all elements of this matrix are zero, which is the identity of the multiplication operation.
        Returns:
        true if all elements of this matrix are zero

      • multiply

        public Matrix<T> multiply(Matrix<T> m)
        Returns a matrix that is the multiplication of this matrix and a specified matrix. If this matrix has a dimension n × m and the specified matrix a × b, then m must be equal to a and the returned matrix has a dimension n × b.
        Parameters:
        m - a matrix whose number of rows is equal to the number of columns of this matrix
        Returns:
        a matrix that is the multiplication of this matrix and m

        Returns:
        this matrix to the power of the specified number
